reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Namibia - Malaria - Ministry of Health and Social Services of Namibia

description.narrative: Namibia - Malaria - Ministry of Health and Social Services of Namibia - MOH. This program has the following goals: Goal: To achieve zero local malaria cases in Namibia by 2022. The objectives of this program are: To protect 100% of targetted population living in malarious areas with at least one appropriate vector control intervention. All suspected malaria cases are tested and 100% of confirmed malaria cases treated according to the national guidelines. By 2020, at least 85% of the population utilize malaria interventions (LLINS or IRS). Fully functional malaria surveillance system for evidence-based action in all districts by 2019. To provide effective leadership and coordination for optimal implementation of malaria intervention at all levels
